intro: Linaria fragilis, commonly known as the slender toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with four petals, which are arranged in a bilabiate shape, characteristic of the Plantaginaceae family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Linaria fragilis is often found in rocky or coastal areas, where it tolerates saline conditions and full sun exposure.
